p.s: I have heard that you ignore the losers of globalisation and due to the fact that I read an article about it, I want to make you aware about the losers of globalisation.
The article shows the life of three people who visited an industry in CambodschaCambodia.
They were shocked about the bad working conditions and the life there.
Besides, they describe that the workers are sitting in almost the same position for hours and that they do the same procedure every day.
The article shows how desolate a life at those industries can be and that the workers often have no choice and hope.
Moreover they refer their lives to our, which underlines the shocking friction between human lifeslives in our today's world.
For example, the workers need to eat the same food every day and they get paid very poorly, considering that they even work much more than we do.
Due to this shocking experience those three people had there in CambodschaCambodia, they decided to be more active to provide such catastrophical conditions in the future.
I hope this opened your eyes my dear friend and that you might rethink your daily behaviour in order to help those losers of globalisation.
